DataElement.preferredName: Person Serious Adverse Event Hemorrhage Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding how the presence of hemorrhaging affects the patient's ability to participate in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Serious Adverse Event Hemorrhage Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a flow of blood from a ruptured blood as a serious adverse event, expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Serious Adverse Event Hemorrhage Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product o procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.:Bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.
The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a recent hi
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a recent history of non-chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenic-associated bleeding less than or equal to 1 year prior to the registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically significant bleeding (i.e. GI bleed, intracranial bleeding) within 6 months or major surgery within 4 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a recent history of non-chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenic-associated bleeding less than or equal to 1 year prior to the first dose of study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a recent history of non-chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenic-associated bleeding within 1 year prior to the first dose of study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient does not have pathologic condition that carries a high risk of bleeding (tumor involvement with major blood vessels or varicies)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any other signs indicative of hemorrhage within 3 months before the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of significant intracranial bleeding (CNS hemorrhage greater than or equal to Grade 2) or other bleeding that would prevent Bevacizumab administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any Grade 3 or above hemorrhage or bleeding event within 4 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any hemorrhage or bleeding event greater than or equal to grade 3 within 4 weeks prior to the start of study medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any hemorrhage or bleeding event greater than or equal to CTCAE Grade 3 within 4 weeks prior to the start of study medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: For patients with asymptomatic evidence of new CNS hemorrhage, does the patient meet the protocol defined criteria for eligibility based on Section 3.2.9?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history of Grade ≥ 2 CNS hemorrhage or history of any CNS hemorrhage within 28 days of study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history of greater than or equal to Grade 2 CNS hemorrhage or history of any CNS hemorrhage within 28 days of study entry?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.4.12 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002300. ak 2023.3.28 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002221. ak
